review:
The functionality and feature parity of Teams is really good across platforms. But the quality of the apps is pretty poor.

Whilst I can handle some rough edges the main deal breaker right now on iOS is the battery drain - it‚Äôs terrible, my iPad was burning through it‚Äôs battery (usually it‚Äôs great) and when I checked the battery usage it was about 70% Teams which was very unreasonable since I‚Äôd only had a short audio call and otherwise the odd text chat. 

My other general annoyance is the theme switching to dark is very clunky - it crashes and reloads the app by design! And this doesn‚Äôt seamlessly switch like most native apps when iOS switches.

Overall I wish some more care was put into the native iOS app - that battery drain is a serious issue - I need to use this on the go with confidence and I can‚Äôt right now.
title: Battery Drain and no auto dark mode

review: This app is really helpful and I love it. But for some reason no matter what image I use I can't change my profile picture. I have even tried doing another way which was updating the profile picture on office 365 since teams and office 365 are connected and nothing has worked. I try to do this at least once a weak but nothing happens. Even when I press that check for updates button . I still doesn't register anything. Also when you update the profile picture though office 365 all the office 365 apps related to it are supposed to update their profile picture and none have updated. When i go into the edit profile picture settings in office 365 it shows that I have saved and I has updated the photo. I have had a look on the internet and I have found that a lot of people are having exactly the same issue. So I would nice if you could try and fix the bug. Because that would be a really good feature to have when you have multiple people in a meeting and you will be able to straight away tell who it is. Apart from that the app is perfect. That is why I am giving it 4 out of 5 stars.
title: Just one major bug

review:
I support teams in a SME environment. It‚Äôs a great app & this review is not so much about Teams itself but M365. There is widespread confusion in our organisation about what Teams is. The fact that you can use Teams as a way to navigate to files stored in SharePoint & then open those files inside in Teams makes people think the files are in Teams when they aren‚Äôt. A lot of people don‚Äôt understand that when using Teams to find files that those files should then be opened in SharePoint & not in Teams because if they are looking at a document in Teams, that document hogs the App & if they need to join a team meeting in Teams they then need to abandon the opened document. There is also confusion about the OneDrive app, which keeps your local OneDrive & Synched SharePoint folders synched with their cloud counterparts and OneDrive Personal File Storage. 
After almost 3 years of working with OneDrive, SharePoint & Teams some people still don‚Äôt get it.
title: Good but

review:
Teams is really super, but it desperately needs to be a multiple document interface style application where you can have multiple things open at the same time.  If you‚Äôre having a meeting and reviewing a task list, navigating to a document that you want to discuss, you have to navigate back to where you were and that‚Äôs all too clumsy.  If you had the ability to minimise what you‚Äôre looking at, follow a link, bring up a calendar, etc. and just tab between the open items within the app, it would become super useful.
Otherwise, I say the concept is great and it occupies a fantastic place between an inbox, calendar, shared folders, workflow manager and IM.  It is everything that an actual team needs.
One last thing‚Ä¶ please make it possible to change the privacy settings on a team channel from team-wide to private or back again, or to have it team-wide plus guests or team-wide minus exceptions.
title: Really good but

review:
I use this app for school and ever since I‚Äôve used it it has been draining my iPad battery I used to only put my iPad on the charger every night or maybe once during the day but with using Microsoft teams I have to put my iPad on the charger after every class has finished, which this is not just only ruining my iPad battery life but also making my iPad extremely hot that I can‚Äôt even touch it properly, and not to mention since I‚Äôve been using this app my iPad now goes off between 50% to 30% which it should be going off at 5% or 10% so this app ruins my iPad battery to the point where I have to buy I new iPad I‚Äôm going to be extremely angry!

So now I‚Äôm having problems with this app logging me in and out of calls when I‚Äôm in them so I‚Äôm missing out on important information for school, and not to mention with my battery draining really fast with this app it is also making my iPad really laggy so if you don‚Äôt fix this ASAP and this RUINS MY IPAD you will BE BUYING ME A NEW IPAD - thanks
title: (PLEASE READü•∫)!

review: Microsoft Teams is a great app except for 2 things. The first thing I will say is said many times in the reviews, it drains so much of my battery. If I forgot to plug my iPad in during the a meeting I have to switch to my laptop and that takes a few minutes, usually I get in trouble with my teacher because they think I‚Äôm skipping class. The second thing is logging back in my account. When I try to log back in it takes me millions of tries to back in. It kicks me out of the app and then after doing that lots it takes 20 minutes to finally get in. Other than that I love how you can text friends, share screens, have groups of teams and breakout rooms. Good luck for fixing these things.
title: Great app but‚Ä¶

review: To start with, teams is an amazing app and very convenient for work and schooling. However, in the screenshots used to show off the app in the App Store we can clearly see a chat button and working chat feature. However, once the app is downloaded this feature is nowhere to be seen, and I even had the feature for about a week when it was first implemented before it randomly disappeared with no warnings or updates. This feature was one of the most useful features and I see absolutely no reason for it not to be there. Until the chat option is re-added, there is blatant false advertising for this app using a feature that is no longer included.
title: Missing feature?!

review: This app has real potential however is missing so many simple (yet important) things. For example you can only see 4 people in a video conference. The changes to capacity to enable you to see more than 4 people have been ‚Äúin the works‚Äù for over a year with no updates! The same goes for changing the profile picture in a group chat. A year ago Microsoft said this was ‚Äúofficially in the works‚Äù but has still not managed to provide this function! You can‚Äôt create a ‚Äòchat‚Äô that is linked directly to a ‚Äòteam‚Äô (you can only ‚Äúpost‚Äù in the team or, create an entirely separate - not linked - chat and add the same people). All of these functions seem so basic and yet don‚Äôt yet exist! Wasted potential really.
title: Missing so many simple things!

review:
I work across multiple organisations as a consultant and Teams has become an absolute pain. It has great potential and a couple of great features but I find that if I forget to sign out of one client‚Äôs site that I can‚Äôt then access another client‚Äôs site‚Ä¶ but then other times I can. Usually I‚Äôve got to hunt around to find which site I‚Äôm signed in to (which I can‚Äôt see where it displays that), sign out, return to the next site and go through all of the security features again. Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn‚Äôt. About 50% of the time I have to send the files to the client via email or request the same back via email so it slows work down. 

‚Ä¶ and the web app doesn‚Äôt work with Safari browsers!
title: A lot of potential but‚Ä¶.

review:
I find the app very convenient and love that I can run my video and sound seperate from my computer, also my computer fails at Bluetooth headset mid meeting the app on iPad and iphone does not
I would prefer the focus screen to option to be under the the same menu as the computer app uses for ease of use and consistency I had to go search how to focus on the shared screen rather than pay attention to what was being shared 
I would also like to see the whole calendar (day, weekly monthly) across the screen until I select an appointment to view details then be able to go back to the overview
title: Works well but...

review:
Running a team for a niche 400+ user area of a large health organisation has been a lot of a challenge. The functionality of the desktop app and sharepoint sites do not always translate to the mobile app. The current issue is that in Channel F we have quick links set up to go to a ‚Äúfolder‚Äù location in the General Channel. They work great in desktop app, browser, sharepoint app, etc. BUT not on the mobile Teams app. I open the sharepoint site for Channel F and click the link and it loads a blank page, nothing else.
I can click the ‚Ä¶ and ask it to open it in my browser which then runs me through 10 step process to login, TFA, etc. etc. on my browser before I can view the information.

It‚Äôs tiresome and wasteful.
Why won‚Äôt you fix all these bugs Microsoft?

OR make it so I can add a Tab to a folder from the General Channel in the Tabs for Channel F. That‚Äôs all I want. But apparently not possible.

Worse than the issues is the hours spent searching for a fix. Hours and hours and hours of my time wasted, but no one seems to give a hoot.
title: Things work then things don‚Äôt

review: I can‚Äôt believe this is the only place I can report this bug. Use case: iPad Pro in Stage Manager mode with Magic Keyboard. Bug: When hovering over the chat message bar (where you type your message), the cursor snaps to the bar that minimises all apps and takes you back to iPad Home Screen. It‚Äôs really frustrating as the snapping is immediate - i have to be really quick to click in the message bar for the snapping to not occur. I‚Äôve minimised my app so many times because of this. It‚Äôs literally the most used part of teams on iPad so please fix this issue. I did a screen recording but there‚Äôs no way for me to report this in so hopefully this report makes sense.
title: Bug when using stage manager + iPad Pro Magic Keyboard

review:
The whole entire Microsoft teams service is an absolute game changer, and is much like having Skype for business & Slack integrated into the same application. Screen sharing is lightning fast. I cannot fault the collaboration side of this service!

The only thing which is quite frustrating, is the inability to have more than four people on screen when in a video chat. To make matters worse, you can‚Äôt swipe to a new page to see any other connected caller's video. Sometimes this can be problematic if a few people are talking at once and the active speaker who you want in the foreground doesn‚Äôt automatically show on screen.

I was very happy to see this was updated on the macOS app and the Windows app. If this feature was added into the iOS app also, 100% would be a 10/10 piece of software which doesn‚Äôt compare to any other platform or service. 

Minor issue, but aside from that, it‚Äôs an excellent service provided by Microsoft
title: Excellent app, just needs one minor addition

review:
It‚Äôs a great app, but there are little things still not done properly. This last update on my 11 Pro Max makes the app runs where sluggish, have to press on things twice sometimes for it to register.
- Bluetooth issues - changed my audio to iPhone half way through meeting from AirPods and it doesn‚Äôt allow me to change back to AirPods (in fact just doesn‚Äôt display AirPods option in audio again.
- before joining the meeting if I have mute on, it‚Äôs auto unmutes after I‚Äôve joined the meeting? Annoying bug.
- no pinned chat functionality. I don‚Äôt understand why it can‚Äôt be replicated from desktop app? If you have pinned chat in desktop app, it should reflect on mobile app.
title: Great but we expect more...hence only 2 star.

review:
Hi - I find it very handy as a part time worker to be able to catch a meeting on a day off without having to sit in front of a computer and stop my other plans. E.g. I washed up today while catching a meeting that keeps me informed.

I have finally got almost used to finding the chat function - there is a menu that I hunt for chat frantically and can‚Äôt find it - but it‚Äôs only when I‚Äôm out of the menu and tapping the screen that the chat option reveals itself. So for me counter-intuitive and frustrating. Thanks for asking!
title: Useful to be mobile but tweak a bit please

review: Teams was the fourth most app using storage on my device (2.9GB of Documents and Data plus the app) and using the Clear downloaded files and Clear app data options within the settings multiple times had no noticeable affect. After completely deleting the app and reinstalling it, it is now using 49KB of Documents and Data plus the app. It seems the two Clearing options within Settings need some attention as they don‚Äôt seem to work as intended.
title: Uses Gigabytes of storage even after clearing downloaded files and app data

review: It is a pleasure for me to have a share. Because I am remote, when I join I feel like part of the family. I learn more about what I should do and how to use the tools we have each time. But it also helps me to appreciate the massive time you all spend translating articles, scripts and recording as well. I also have learned from recent meetings that the GB has shown love and thoughtfulness to the Motu public in approving the translation of public magazines. What a blessing!
title: Working with teams

review:
I have a situation that my Teams client on iOs14 kept getting blocked by azure conditional access policy that requires both MFA and limited access to Teams service and its dependencies EXO, SPO, Skype4B. The login failed to pass the conditional access policies because the Teams-T4L application only recognised single factor authentication and got blocked by MFA requirements at Microsoft Teams Login Service.

Meanwhile on the same phone using Safari browser I can connect to Teams web app successfully.

Way to go!
title: Doesn‚Äôt support MFA & Azure conditional access policy well

review:
Teams is a revolution in collaboration, the functionality is much more effective than the old SharePoint. The MS Office suite is very well integrated, you can have lots of different people working on the same file at once, you can chat directly about the collaboration in the file.
The meeting functionality is great, call quality is excellent and having the App on your smartphone means you‚Äôll never miss a meeting again.
If your team isn‚Äôt using MS Teams yet, then you‚Äôre working in the ‚Äòstone age‚Äô, email is dead, persistent chat is now!
title: Teams is excellent

review: Teams is a really great way to communicate with others! You can send images, emojis, GIFs and attachments, make group chat, have an audio or video call, chat with lots of people and use an app that‚Äôs actually organised. There are many tabs that have different features, and the app is super functional and easy to use. Only downside is that it takes up a lot of mobile data and storage on your phone, so I would advise using it on your laptop.
title: I love Teams!

review: While this is one of the most helpful tools, but it would probably be one of the worst as well. The individual chat screen sometimes becomes full screen with no way to return to the chat list, and it also doesn‚Äôt handle landscape/portrait switches as would any tablet user typically use a tablet. I really wish they improve the UX of this app; we are using this every day for work. These UX glitches are not easily ignored.
title: Bad UX

review:
Love the app. It‚Äôs awesome. Works great across multiple platforms with great features... but...
The notifications on mobile can get pretty overwhelming. Particularly when you‚Äôre not using the device. 
For example when your IM‚Äôing from desktop you still get EVERY notification on your phone. You can sleep the phone notifications but you then need to remember to re-enable them. 
General notification handling could be improved for message flood conditions too. I am part of several larger organisation group chats. 
When there are multiple people discussing in the thread there can be dozens of notifications in short succession. 
An implementation similar to FBMessenger would be great - you get a sound and pop up for the first one and then any notifications comin in short succession (say within 30s-1minute since the last notification) are delivered quietly.
title: Awesome... but better notification handling is needed

review:
For about four years I have been looking for a collaboration system to get away from the burden and inefficiencies of email. I have been using Whatsapp for work projects but then I was introduced to TEAMS!
So well thought out, adaptive and easy to use. The desktop, iPhone & iPad layout are all user friendly. 
Our organisation has only been using it for four weeks but it is already streamlining workflow, response times are shortened and there is improved engagement amongst project members. Well done Microsoft.
title: What I have been waiting for

review: There is issues with status that goes amber or offline even if you are online and regardless of changing status manually or resetting it sometime doesn‚Äôt work .. rebooting app helps but sometime you need to reboot laptop . Understand if this happens once in a while but this is quiet frequently happening and then if you switch meeting call from mobile to desktop it‚Äôs shows to other audiences that you are leaving meeting .
title: Intermittent issues

review: The phone is a great tool for ensuring you can still access your meetings and collaborate effectively when you‚Äôre away from your desk. However one improvement I would like to see is the ability to access the chat functionality while also on a teams call. Currently if you‚Äôre on a call there‚Äôs no ability to read or respond to chats in teams.
title: Great app for business

review:
Ever since my brother turned 4 (he is seven now, a trouble maker) he was an idiot and an extremely annoying person. I am embarrassed to be related to him. I have been using teams for work, meetings, etc. Suddenly, I saw a brand new chat and it‚Äôs my annoying brother. I tried my very best to delete the chat but it ended up having my best friend with the most annoying brother in the universe. You must allow us to delete and block other people in chats. DO IT OR YOU WILL BE ONE OF MY SIBLINGS!!!

By Unknown grade 5 student from Australia, Queensland, Brisbane, Rochdale, Redeemer Lutheran College (school).
title: MUST READ OR ELSE

review:
The calendar section needs to be able to show old calendar appointments. That would have be having to switch to Outlook.

Another issue is how when I use my phone for a call, it massively zooms in on my face so the person on a PC on the other end of the call gets a closeup. This happens to everyone I know. It needs to be more mobile friendly and out or have a visible on-screen guide on how far away the phone should rest so other call participants aren‚Äôt talking to a nose.
title: Great but needs couple of improvements

review: Thank goodness we moved to Teams about 9 months before COVID! Our levels of document collaboration and use of video chat tied into our filing and messaging has been life changing for the business. The more we rely on it the more we need better training and structure to our use however as things can get lost (documents in particular) between Chat and Files - this is about how you use it not a flaw in Teams itself
title: Revolutionised our Organisation

review:
...trying to run larger meetings, you can‚Äôt (choose to) see more than FOUR participants!

Checking chat groups/microsoft forums re this problem, which has been brought up many times over the last year, NOTHING but vague promises have eventuated.

Another thing, some participants don‚Äôt want to use their cam due to data limitations, and prefer to have a profile picture.
Should be easy to do? FORGET IT! 
1. Tried to upload a profile picture, only to be told it‚Äôs the wrong format, try again. Tried jpeg, bmp, png, gif, small or largish - NOTHING!
2. No guide as to what went wrong or what format, size to use - NOTHING!

For a company flogging a ‚Äòcommunication‚Äô app, your communication skills fall very short of the mark - FAIL!

We‚Äôve tried to run modestly sized meetings with 10-30 participants for work. Nobody‚Äôs been happy with the experience. So it looks we‚Äôll  be dumping it.

Time to move on...

PS Skype (another Microsoft takeover that went downhill) has the same problems
title: It‚Äôs ok for small meetings, HOWEVER...

review: This app keeps my day on track when I‚Äôm away from my pc a lot. Quick access to calendar or chats is easy.  There‚Äôs a bug when you switch devices, the video doesn‚Äôt show to your caller but you can see that it is on. Clicking video on and off, changing device settings doesn‚Äôt fix it. You have to hang up and call again.
title: Switching devices

review:
Teams is okay, i use it for work so I tried signing back using my new phone and it would not work! I really wanna know what the issue is because it used to work on my old phone but now it tells me that my internet connection is bad and i need to connect to it for teams to work but my internet is fine
I have also tried logging back into my account through the website but it still doesn‚Äôt work
I even used my friends work email and it doesn‚Äôt work constantly reminding me of my internet connection when that is not an issue! This is incredible frustrating and annoying!
title: Okay

review:
With teams replacing the Skype for Business app on the desktop, this app needs to be updated with the appropriate functionality. 

Right now, if I switch over to using only teams on my desktop I end up receiving all my notifications on my phone with Skype for Business. I can‚Äôt delete Skype for business because the teams iOS app has no functionality to join meetings.
title: Needs to be updated with meetings functionality

review: If you delve into Teams‚Äô advanced features, you quickly discover a huge range of useful add-ins that let you do just about anything from within the Teams UI. It‚Äôs almost an entire operating system specifically aimed at collaboration with your colleagues. And the best bit is my emails have dropped from hundreds to tens per day as well. It is taking over from Excel as my all time favourite piece of software, and I‚Äôve been using Excel since 1996.
title: Flexible Teams

review:
My small team of 5 is quite impressed by the app and the product in general. Meetings, chats, notes, wiki. The only thing we don't have is screen sharing which I hope is in the pipeline. We were never keen on signing up to another collaboration software because. HipChat was ok but not good enough for us. Never tried Slack and probably won't ever have to now that this is making our work lives so much easier.

4.5 stars because there's no screen sharing yet. Otherwise, it's a 5 from me!
title: We love it!

review: MTeams is so easy to use. It‚Äôs amazing how many functionalities are accessible to a user at the same time and how easy one can navigate through. I used Teams for my job and can connect to my team from home or my phone. The ability to access files and high level meetings from a single app without connection issues is awesome.
title: Swift and smooth experience

review:
Guys, WHY did you remove the ability to have multiple managed accounts on the app? It was working perfectly with no issues. 
One Tuesday morning I woke up and had the notification a number of weeks back that multiple accounts weren‚Äôt allowed (anymore, it seems). 
When you‚Äôre working for more than one related client, this makes life very difficult. 
Please explain why you did this, and WHEN will this decision be reversed.
title: Multiple Accounts - Give Them Back to Us

review: I put this on my phone, and it works great, but when I tried the pc version on my laptop, after a few months it started taking a full ten minutes to load, as well as randomly crashing and saying I had messages when there were none. Now I just use the phone version, but I‚Äôd like for the pc version o work a little better.
title: Phone version works fine, but pc version is full of glitches.

review: The app is great for communicating in channels, however for some reason there‚Äôs no option to change an existing public channel into a private channel. This means that you have to recreate a channel that would be private which means all the files on your public channel have to be manually moved over to the new private channel. I think this is really counterproductive and wish they come out with a new update to fix that.
title: Channels issue

review: Video and voice calls not available on iOS 12.4.6 iPhone 6s.  Attempting to make a call (voice or video) provides a prompt to settings to allow access to microphone.  When pressing the settings button, it takes me to Teams settings and there is no microphone setting which can be changed.  In fact there are no settings under Teams settings section.  Going another way to microphone settings via iOS settings also shows the app has not even requested microphone use.  Therefore the app is essentially just a texting platform, which is useless.  Tired of being R&D testers for large corps.
title: No microphone setting to allow use on iOS

review: I‚Äôve been inspired to write this 2 star review because there are just some hair-pulling rage inducing features that should be simple and easy that don‚Äôt seem to be available - in my case, the ability to delete or rename a folder. It‚Äôs things like this that make me think - is it me? Am I just missing some big and obvious button? But the internet is devoid of answers other than ‚Äúlog in on your browser‚Äù - and if that is the best solution than why bother with the app in the first place? Below average.
title: Basic things missing

review: I do online school right now because I have lockdown in australia central coast I‚Äôm 8 years old and I think this is a great way to communicate with my teachers and friends ok I need to say if I didn‚Äôt have teams I would not have been able to find my work and  I don‚Äôt have to be online all day I just look at my work and do it. You should get teams and it is free
title: Amazing

review:
If you run TEAMS on multiple devices of yours, as soon as the first one get the notification message, other devices won‚Äôt show you the notification message assuming you have seen it already on your first device. Well, that‚Äôs not desired because I am not always in front of my laptop but I do always carry my phone with myself.

Please broadcast notification messages to all devices. Or at least give the option to users to choose this feature or not.
title: Need notification on multiple devices

review: Unlike the desktop app you can have multiple organisations which all receive push notifications and calls. The desktop developers seem adamant on torturing consultants who work with multiple companies because you have to sign out and back in each time.
title: Multiple organisations supported

review: I am really enjoying Teams having just set it up for our company. My one great disappointment is that you can only see 4 people on a group video. It is really difficult to read the mood of the meeting when you can't see everyone. This is where Zoom has a huge advantage in being able to see multiple people on one screen and everyone in the  meeting by swiping through the screens. Unless this is addressed soon we will have to use Zoom for our team meetings.
title: Zoom wins on video meetings!

review: This app is really good for collaborating with my team, in and out of the office. A major complaint is that it consumes a lot of battery, even when I‚Äôm not using it. An example: my iPad has teams installed but I leave it at home whilst I‚Äôm out at work. I would find that the battery has drained overtime by quite a lot and I‚Äôd notice that Teams had consisted of 80% of that battery usage. Microsoft, I urge you to fix this issue as this app is great but this really needs to be better optimised for mobile devices.
title: Great app but battery hungry!

review:
I love the way Teams brings the many groups I work with, right to my desk, and even my pocket!
It would also be good to access files on the App, so I can review video recordings of meetings when away from the office. 
It would also be great to have access to just the audio from video files, saving on data while still accessing the audio side of messages. :)
title: File access needed on App

review:
In our teams chat, we update and share content, but when there‚Äôs new updates to posts, I don‚Äôt like how it shifts to the bottom, I‚Äôve mixed up my roster a few times (mostly my fault) but would make it easier if what is posted stays where it had been originally posted.  Hope that makes sense ‚ò∫Ô∏è 

Besides that, it is for the most part a great app and I would recommend.
title: Updates

review:
I like this app but there is 1 problem which is that teachers can mute students and that shouldn‚Äôt be aloud because it is limiting our ability‚Äôs to talk and it isn‚Äôt fair us student should be able to speak to each other and for the record NO ONE IN MY CLASS LIKES IT DO YOU HEAR ME OR IN THIS CASE READ ME NO ONE YES THAT‚ÄôS RIGHT NOOOOOOOO ONE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
But other wise it‚Äôs not bad but maybe if you n are taking suggestions i have 2:
1.get rid of the mute thing 
And 2.maybe add something fun for kids to do like a game
title: WHAT KIDS LIKE AND DON‚ÄôT LIKE

review:
Just started using this through work. Have the phone app and windows App. Have no major complaints.

I‚Äôd like to see the ability to add custom backgrounds in video conferences and also turn off the auto away status. I‚Äôd really like to set my own status and keep it. Also when my laptop is closed and opened again, it seems to disconnect and will not reconnect until I open the window and let it load.
title: Good but could be great

review:
Since Sunday no matter what I do, I can‚Äôt see any reports they my boss sends out for us to look at. It was working find last Friday but no all I get is a black space with a circle in the middle which has a arrow at the end of the circle. I press this and nothing happens. 
I‚Äôm not sure what happened to this app
title: Can‚Äôt see reports that my boss sends

review: The one thing that‚Äôs best about teams is that I can text up friends when my friends wot to text me they can just go to teams and texts I love is when that you can make a group chat of your friends and your other friends and they can get to know each so that‚Äôs why I love team teams chat
title: The best thing about team

review: There needs to be a way to delete a message I‚Äôve sent without Teams posting a note saying ‚Äòmessage deleted‚Äô. I‚Äôm not sure what the purpose of letting people know I‚Äôve deleted a message is? I deleted it because I no longer want them to see the message. Now they will ask why I deleted the message and want to know what the message was.
title: Mostly good but needs some upgrades

review: The biggest frustration with teams is that it does not have full desk top functionality when using an iPad. The other big disappointment is that you can never trust the formatting of a document written in a browser version of word. It always seems to stuff up. I am a big fan of cloud based and team based computing, I just cross my fingers they will improve the functionality on the iPad.
title: Desktop Functionality missing on iPad

review: MS Teams is probably one of the smartest / user friendly transforming business tools I‚Äôve used. Only started with MS Teams 8 days ago. I‚Äôm working remotely as is the entire world, and the level of connection I‚Äôm experiencing is unbelievable. I‚Äôve had no training, we had to implement immediately and we were up and running in a day. Thank you! I really mean it Thank you!
title: CPO

review: This app is great! I have used it for school and it works really well. The loading is usually very fast and it doesn‚Äôt glitch a lot. Many features are there. The original one was really lousy, but this new one can let you see 9 or every person and allows you to raise your hand. This app is highly recommended.
title: Awesome!

review: While we had Teams on our system prior to Co-Vid, we only utilised it for National catch ups. Since WFM inCo-Vid, we utilise it throughout our business internally over telephoning. Our non-centralised team members report they feel closer to the team and more part of it then when we worked in the office. It‚Äôs easily accessible and ensures that all team members are work ready in a WFM situation.
title: How Teams Meeting works for us

review: I have my teams work account on my personal iPhone as a backup however I have just deleted the app as the latest update has removed the sign out option under my profile picture and my teams calls are displayed with my iPhone call log and there is no option to disable this. WFH personal and work line is blurred and this app is not helpful when getting teams calls after hours.
title: No sign out option and teams calls are in phone call logs

review:
Very happy with this app!
Few things Teams could improve:
- The layout of the people who appear in the screen, we should be able to choose the ones or see them all,
- Connect team with Microsoft forms, so people could answer questions instantaneously while during presentation
title: Screen layout

review: Teams is great, i use it to message friends in class sometimes, I only have one problem with it. The profile pictures don‚Äôt change/update when I change it, and my friends can‚Äôt see when I change it and visa versa. Please try to find a solution to this because it‚Äôs kinda annoying.
title: Profile Picture Problem

review:
Are use teams a lot for work and other roles that I have, and as I use Accessibility/VoiceOver on iOS/iOS, it can be cumbersome.

Also, I use Google workspace as my host and as a small business it‚Äôs very difficult to speak to anyone at Microsoft regarding technical support as my account has not been set up correctly, and I am unable to speak to human, unlike Apple which makes it very annoying
title: Difficult to use in iOS accessibility/VoiceOver mode

review: Whilst I enjoy teams a great deal trying to delete a former employee is nothing short of an admin nightmare. I can‚Äôt believe Microsoft has made this such a hazardous journey. Endless loops of password resetting, reset denials and no one to assist other than a robot. Glad MS is catching up to Google but still have a long way to go.
title: Delete former employee from Teams

review: At the beginning of COVID Teams became our clinical lifeline and it was intuitive and responsive to our needs. Now I work from home and it‚Äôs my easy connection with sensible operation and cool features. I love the whiteboard function, the recording versatility and comprehensive chat capacity. It‚Äôs reliable and dynamic which is reflective of our new world!
title: Teams rocks!

review:
I started using the Teams app last year when work sent us home. I found it was good to join meetings from my phone using the calandra function rather than my computer.
Now I‚Äôm back in the office I haven‚Äôt used the App as much but when I have returned to the Apo i have found that after a few updates the calendar on the app doesn‚Äôt have my meetings and I can‚Äôt join on the phone anymore.
I‚Äôve still got all the Teams stuff I don‚Äôt want but don‚Äôt have the only Teams function I did use, so it‚Äôs useless for me.
One star is generous
title: Calendar

review: It‚Äôs 2020, we shouldn‚Äôt be unable to upload a profile photo. can you please fix this? I read that this has been going on at least since 2018. Can‚Äôt upload photo from computer or iphone. please improve User experience.
title: Please FIX the upload photo problem

review: Developers need to acknowledge that there are still issues joining a meeting set up and active on a laptop/desktop interface for audio only via iPhone. Many times my colleagues and I connect only to hear silence. We have reported this through multiple channels to no avail... we have also experienced this problem outside our work IT environment, so we suspect it is an app problem and not on our side.
title: Still buggy with iPhone but not bad

review:
Clunky navigation when trying to access multiple facilities, e.g. chat or calendar while in a meeting.

And one epic fail: Every other iPhone & iPad app is perfectly happy to automatically share/move Apple Air Pods (Pro) between two devices, but not Teams. Regularly have to manually reconnect the Air Pods to the iPad to get Teams to use them.  Of course, that always happens when you‚Äôre rushing into a meeting.  Get it right Teams!
title: Ok, but ‚Ä¶

review: Absolutely love Teams and the iOS app for workplace productivity and collaboration. On a very minor note, there seems to be limited trackpad support on the iPad app, the cursor does not interact will with the ‚ÄúType a message‚Äù field, it just seems to hard lock-up until you move away from that area. Would be great for that to be fixed.
title: Great collaboration tool - Minor bug

review:
I find this App pretty difficult to use compared to competitive products.
In particular, it is almost impossible to change ones profile picture‚Ä¶ on other apps this is quite easy.
The Chat function is also hard to find.
Te participants list cannot be spread onto a second screen so takes up screen Realestate .
Summary- its pretty clunky - and I prefer other products
title: Difficult to use, impossible to change profile picture

review:
Hi have been using teams for our online Med scenarios. 
I produce teams - 6 Groups of students to manage patients. 
We produce documents etc with these discussions. 
I have general meeting open alll day as we move from channels in small groups to webinars. 
Is it possible to be able to access more than 4 channels. As I move between team channels at various points of the day to assist the student teams in their discussions.
title: Access to channels

review: Microsoft are constantly improving the user experience within Teams. I don‚Äôt see the frequent crash that used to happen earlier. But some of the keys things are still missing - sometimes that‚Äôs date format switches to US only.. Overall the experience is getting better
title: Improved Experience with Teams

review: I have been using teams know for several weeks . The more I use it the more I seem to understand different aspects. It was hard at first. I wish that we could see more people. I may suggest there is a lot of stuff posted abut teams .. some of it is very detailed and hard to understand for most . Try and keep it simple .
title: Teams

review: Having Teams available as an app makes my life so much easier when having to do meetings on the go whilst dropping off and picking up kids. Hardly have any issues with it on my iPhone. The issues I do have, usually resolve with a restart of the app.
title: Easy and efficient

review: I like the way it seamlessly integrates into MS products. Good functionality around calls, tasks, notes. I was also impressed with the breakout teams feature. All in all good and we could add a few more. The organising of meetings could get a lot easier through teams ...I still use outlook though.
title: Good Job !

review:
Teams was foisted on my workplace, as part of cost cutting (we turned off slack), but it fails to provide the work place utility. It‚Äôs one of those apps where you‚Äôre constantly fighting it to perform basic things.

Chat is slow (although, ipad is the best performing platform), space is not used well, it‚Äôs constantly adding features no one asks for, and failing to build out the minimum functions (5 years wait for native Mac notifications ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è)

If you have any agency, do not go near.
title: Don‚Äôt be fooled - terrible app that‚Äôs overbloated and undercooked

review:
This app is great! Really useful especially now we‚Äôre in the work from home times. 

A bug I‚Äôve experienced quite often is when I tap on a Teams message notification, I get put in a ‚Äúswitching loop‚Äù. It looks like it attempts to switch accounts/orgs but then it instantly fails and tries again after a split second. 

The only way to fix this is to close and reopen the app
title: Switching loop

review:
The app works really well to connect to MS Teams and SharePoint using existing credentials. Too well.

Once you log in, it stays logged in. There is no subsequent authentication, even after you restart your phone. You can log out, but that is behind several clicks, so not likely to be used by people who use an app for quick convenience. So you stay logged in, and anyone who can access your phone can then access (edit, delete) files on your Teams and SharePoint. You wouldn‚Äôt use a banking app if it behaved this way, so why should corporate file access be any different?

Microsoft, please add at least one layer of authentication, eg like in the Outlook app. An optional 2FA would be even better.

Thanks.
title: Useful‚Ä¶ but with a gaping security hole

review:
Teams really simplifies the workflows and processes and the user experience is really sophisticated and standard for all the channels. 
I really like the part of joining the meeting straight from the email to the conference bridge (no need type any phone numbers and meeting ids etc) ! Keep up the good work ‚ÄòTeams‚Äô Team!
title: Wonderful App which delivers value

review: Firstly, I should start with acknowledging the hard work put into this app from the designing to creating it. It has great features and all but I use it for school assignments and it lags out. For an example, I was doing a test and it drained so much battery I couldn‚Äôt finish since my iPad ran out of battery. Please fix this bug.ü´°
title: Needs Fixing?!

review: Pretty good app. BUT Some basic features on mobile app aren‚Äôt available on desktop, like ability to reply to a specific message and ability to see when someone was ‚Äòlast seen‚Äô. Also often can‚Äôt share files from other apps via Teams and can‚Äôt switch calls between phone and laptop easily unless it‚Äôs in a scheduled meeting.
title: Mobile better than desktop but lacks some integration

review: The user status doesn‚Äôt get synced with the status set in the desktop application or the outlook calendar. One would expect that the app shows the user as available only when he actively looks at the mobile app and when the app is minimized or closed, it would show the status set in the desktop app or calendar. But no, that‚Äôs not how this works and more often the behaviour is kind of random too.
title: User status issue
